pages.text: Hibernaspis is a jawless fish which was a benthic animal that likely lived most of its life buried in the sand, feeding off micro organisms. The edges of its head shield had many small ridges and it had a pair of tiny degenerated eyes at th tip of the head. It lived in a series of hypersaline lagoons along with other species of Amphiaspids.
